Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: two lines at base of wall above traces of undetermined motif in handle zone; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 26 is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0881) (phase 2)
